;; Benefits of Solar energy: ;
;
;; 1. ; Solar technology is renewable. We never have to worry about running using sunlight or using everything up. The sun can be a consistent power source meaning it's always going to be there every morning.
;
;; two. ; Solar energy is green. Compared to fossil fuels which release greenhouses gas, carcinogens and carbon dioxide, solar panels don't release anything in the air.
;
;; 3. ; Solar panels are extremely reliable. You can find no moving parts so you don't have to worry about replacing anything. In truth, most people generate electricity for tens of thousands of hours with minimal maintenance.
;
;; 4. ; Solar cells generate no noise while collecting energy. There are no some other renewable energy sources which might be completely silent.
;
;; 5. ; Eventually, solar electricity is cheaper than buying it in the power company. There is a start up cost, then again it starts paying for itself. Once you destroy even, everything after that is profit. Compare this to paying a payment and getting no roi.
;
;; 6. ; You will find there's huge variety of solar panel systems available. Some can cost tens of thousands of dollars, and some cost just a couple of hundred. This means anyone may get into solar, there's an entry point for almost everybody.
;
;; 7. ; You're not required to connect to the strength grid. You can get completely self-sufficient and live off-the-grid. Imagine never paying another payment or hook-up charge.
;
;; 8. ; Distribute excess electricity. If you build a large enough solar section system, you can make your electric meter spin backwards! Most power companies will gladly buy or credit you for this excess electricity. Contact any local power companies for additional information.
;
;; 9. ; Federal tax credits. Most governments will provide some kind of tax credit or incentive for people purchasing solar energy systems. On average, rebates usually cover 20-30% in the system cost. Contact any local representatives for more facts.
;
;; 10. ; Solar technology is actually improving. Solar installations are increasing by an incredible 50% every year, most of which are small homemade systems.
